text: I have a question so simple it's almost embarrassing to ask. When I run `fit!` on a machine, particularly when tuning hyperparameters, it uses cross-validation by default. My intuition here is that it would evaluate the model over x folds and average the results. And then it will train the _final_ model on the whole dataset, in the case of hyperparameter optimisation using the best hyperparameters (which would probably need to be evaluated on a holdout data set). Have I got that right?
